page.title: 18Recreation
page.content: There are 3 public houses. Pebworth's Mason's Arms, has a comfortable lounge and public bar, juke box, fruit machine, darts, dominoes and quiz teams. Cold food is served. Long Marston's Mason's Arms, attracts younger custom. 2 linked rooms house a piano and fruit machine. There are darts, quiz and air gun teams and a popular skittle alley. Hot food is served. The unique quality of Broad Marston's Shoulder of Mutton has been retained by one family for 3 generations. Small, thatched, with no spirits licence or bar, customers are served through a hatch. The elderly owners use their sitting room as a "snug". The public house remains important to rural life providing a meeting place for all sections of the village.
